question.text: Which of the following is the correct description of the mechanism of action of a copper IUD?

options.text: These inhibit ovulation and implantation as well as alter the quality of cervical mucus to prevent or retard entry of sperms.
These increase phagocytosis of sperms within the uterus and the certain ions released from it suppress sperm motility and the fertilising capacity of sperms.
Ovum and sperms are prevented from physically meeting.
These prevent conception by blocking the entry of sperms through the cervix.

solution.text:
Mechanism of action of Cu IUDs: IUDs induce the contraceptive effect by -
A. IUDs promote the phagocytosis of sperms within the uterus.
B. Cu ions released suppress the sperm motility and the fertilizing capacity of sperms.
